SEARCH
Package ca.openosp.openo.decisionSupport.model

Class DSConsequence

java.lang.Object
ca.openosp.openo.decisionSupport.model.DSConsequence
public class DSConsequence extends Object
Represents the outcome or action that should be triggered when decision support guideline conditions are met.

DSConsequence defines what happens when clinical guideline conditions evaluate to true. Consequences can be warnings displayed to healthcare providers, recommendations for specific clinical actions, or executable Java code for automated system actions.

Each consequence has a type (warning or java) and an optional strength level to indicate the clinical importance of the recommendation or warning.

Since:
2009-07-06
Author:
apavel
See Also:
  • for condition evaluation that triggers consequences
  • for guideline composition using consequences

      public DSConsequence()

  • Method Details

    • getText

      public String getText()
      Gets the textual content of this consequence. For warning-type consequences, this contains the message displayed to healthcare providers. For java-type consequences, this may contain code or configuration information.
      Returns:
      String containing the consequence message or content

    • setText

      public void setText(String text)
      Sets the textual content of this consequence.
      Parameters:
      text - String containing the consequence message, warning text, or code content

    • getConsequenceType

      public DSConsequence.ConsequenceType getConsequenceType()
      Gets the type of action this consequence represents. Determines whether the consequence displays a warning or executes Java code.
      Returns:
      ConsequenceType indicating warning or java execution

    • setConsequenceType

      public void setConsequenceType(DSConsequence.ConsequenceType consequenceType)
      Sets the type of action this consequence represents.
      Parameters:
      consequenceType - ConsequenceType defining the action type (warning or java)

    • getConsequenceStrength

      public DSConsequence.ConsequenceStrength getConsequenceStrength()
      Gets the clinical importance level of this consequence. Used to prioritize warnings and recommendations in the clinical interface.
      Returns:
      ConsequenceStrength indicating the clinical priority level

    • setConsequenceStrength

      public void setConsequenceStrength(DSConsequence.ConsequenceStrength consequenceStrength)
      Sets the clinical importance level of this consequence.
      Parameters:
      consequenceStrength - ConsequenceStrength defining the priority level

    • getObjConsequence

      public List<Object> getObjConsequence()
      Gets the list of objects associated with executable consequences. Used primarily for java-type consequences that require additional data objects or parameters for execution.
      Returns:
      List of Object instances for consequence execution, may be null

    • setObjConsequence

      public void setObjConsequence(List<Object> objConsequence)
      Sets the list of objects associated with executable consequences.
      Parameters:
      objConsequence - List of Object instances needed for consequence execution
